section.name: Multi-currency. Exchange gain or loss. Exchange difference.
section.p: Keywords: multi-currency, exchange gain or loss, exchange difference, foreign currency transactions.

* New features described in this article available in version 1.1.7 (in source code right now). In current published version 1.1.6 you can only report exchange gain or loss, you can't print sales invoice in foreign currency and you can't track payments in foreign currency.

If you sell a merchandise that is paid in foreign currency, and you use the ACCRUAL method (you have to report revenue for unpaid sales), and currency exchange rate is different when the payment occurred, then you face "exchange difference". You will never face an exchange difference if you use the CASH method, except if you sell currency. In that case, it's not actually "exchange difference", it's ordinal "difference between purchase price and sales one", i.e. currency is ordinal goods in that case.

The most countries have a similar law about foreign currency transactions, that is:
you have to make records in national currency (and language).
selling/buying transaction is made with the current exchange rate (booking date)
payment transaction is made with the current exchange rate (payment date)
difference between booking and payment rates (gain or loss) is business revenue or expense.
